intro: Astragalus geyikdaghensis, commonly known as the Geyikdagh milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow to green flowers that are clustered in racemes, typical of many Astragalus species. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with numerous small leaflets, and it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Astragalus geyikdaghensis is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
